intro: Polyceratocarpus gossweileri, commonly known as the African horned cucumber, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by distinctive, horn-shaped fruits that are edible when young. Its botanical features include a robust stem, palmate leaves, and a unique fruit morphology that sets it apart from other members of its family. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas.
